questionText: What is a callback function in JavaScript?
options: A function that is passed as an argument to another function
A function that is executed when a button is clicked
A function that returns a value
A function that is used to declare a variable

questionText: What is inheritance in object-oriented programming?
options: A mechanism by which one class is able to inherit properties and methods from another class
A way of creating new instances of an object
A way of looping through an array

questionText: What is a stack data structure?
What is the difference between null and undefined in JavaScript?
options: Null is an assignment value that represents no value or no object; undefined means a variable has been declared but has not yet been assigned a value
Null is a built-in function in JavaScript; undefined is a reserved keyword
Null is used to terminate a loop; undefined is used to declare a new variable
Null and undefined are the same thing

questionText: What is polymorphism in object-oriented programming?
options: A concept by which objects of different classes can be treated as if they are objects of the same class
A way of creating new instances of an object
A way of looping through an array

questionText: What is a queue data structure?
What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that has access to variables in its outer scope, even after the outer function has returned
A way of declaring a new variable
